question: Consider the equation $30=\pi h^2 \dfrac{9-h}{3}$ in the set $[2,3]$. Using Newton's method, how many iterations are needed to obtain an approximation to the solution with an absolute error less than $10^{-3}$.

Solve the following linear system:
$$\begin{cases}
x & + & 3y & - & z & + & w & = & -2 \\
3x & - & y & - & 3z & - & 4w & = & 1 \\
2x & + & 3y & - & 5z & + & w & = & -3
\end{cases}$$
answer1: The solutions of the system are of the form $\bigg(\frac{22w+7}{15},\,\frac{-7w-7}{10},\,\frac{11w+11}{30}\bigg)$ for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.
answer3: The system has $\left(1,\,2,\,6,\,-2\right)$ as its unique solution.
answer4: The system has $\left(3w,\,w-1,\,2w,\,w\right)$ as solution for every $w\in\mathbb{R}$.

$$\begin{array}{l c c} 
\hline
\text{Lot} & \text{Conforming} & \text{Nonconforming} \\ 
\hline
A & 88  & 12 \\ 
B & 165 & 35 \\ 
C & 260 & 40 \\ 
\hline
\end{array}$$

What can we say about the relative extrema of the function $f:(0,\infty) \times (0,\infty)\rightarrow \mathbb R$ given by $f(x,y)= x^2+xy+y^2-4\ln (x) -10\ln( y)+3$?
answer1: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative minimizer.
answer2: The points $M(1,2)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer3: The point $M(2,1)$ is a relative maximizer.
answer4: The points $M(2,1)$ and $N(1,2)$ are relative minimizer and respectively, relative maximizer.

question: Conclude about the existence of local maxima, local minima, and saddle points of $f\left(x,y\right)=xy-x^3-y^2$.
